tweets.text:
We're lifting large, heavy glass panels into the gardens of Almery Terrace, York, with a crane to raise the flood defences to help protect 134 properties from flooding. 

For safety we've closed between Almery Terrace & the River Ouse to cyclists & pedestrians until mid Dec. https://t.co/YopfFz85aT
An important question, so great that @EnvAgency is a collaborator in this excellent Living Lab experiment. Superb work here from Patrick Peters. https://t.co/MGPWb6poaR

@JonBurn32130960 @SaveStonehenge @PINSgov @UNESCOUK @UNESCO @ICOMOSUK @EnvAgency @holland_tom @grantshapps @AmesburyMuseum @CllrWhitehead Examining Authority

tweets.text:
It's #FloodActionWeek!

Make it your aim to know what to do in a flood to keep yourself and the things you love safe.

Learn what to do in a flood in the @EnvAgency 's great video below.

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/D8k74PrXaM

As we near the end of #FloodActionWeek. To protect love ones, property and belongings. Preparation is key this winter flood season. To find out more visit https://t.co/29saU1M83o. Why not test your knowledge by doing this quiz. üåäüè† https://t.co/hVz6r9v3YT

Learn more üëâ https://t.co/8nMu4r8WoM
#SlowTheFlow #FloodActionWeek #Dartmoor https://t.co/J8QSThbDga

The Overflow Generator made the news in Belgium! Can our levees withstand super storms? Patrik Peeters, @DepartementMOW, explains how the tests help answer this question - in Dutch
#news #watermanagement #flooddefence #climateadaptation #climatechange
https://t.co/f8b6PxE1HX

tweets.text:
Floods can destroy your most treasured possessions.

Taking a few simple steps now can help protect your home and family.

Don‚Äôt lose what you love to a flood: https://t.co/xKGAQ9Oqsr

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/AWlCNioPNv

tweets.text:
@EnvAgencyYNE @YorkCycle @CityofYork @YorkCycleworks @YorkBikeBelles @YorkshireWater Is that the finished gate? 
If so, what is the benefit when the wall is lower so lets water around the panel?

We have fined a company more than ¬£7,000 for illegally abstracting water.

They took more than 5 million litres of water, enough to fill 2 Olympic sized swimming poolsüòû

Read more: https://t.co/up0bIztUhW #Crime #Water #Cambridgeshire https://t.co/hwcnTFbEpG

Partnerships ü§ù, applying the science üë©‚Äçüî¨, and the next generation üë©‚Äçüè´, all key to future flood risk management üåäüí¶, #ADAConference2020 told by guest speakers: David Cooper @DefraWater | @CStoate @AllertonProject @GWCT | @TobyWillisonEA @EnvAgency https://t.co/E2MUswmpp9

For @EnvAgency #FloodActionWeek, we're taking a look at the work happening across the Partnership this winter that will help to reduce flooding. Here's a look at what we're up to in the Midlands @EnvAgencyMids, and why slowing the flow of water from the hills is so important #NFM https://t.co/SKw5Dn7vHU

This barely alive #carp is from a fishery where so far 60+ similar sized specimens have suffered & died from a susp‚Äô viral infection, our lab will confirm. Possibly from 3 Koi which were illegally dumped into the lake. Please DO-NOT illegally move fish! ‚Å¶@EnvAgencyNW‚Å© plsRT https://t.co/VW4jmB0gIF

Beautiful brown trout filmed this week in the #Trent at @StaffsUni. Fish of this size may now be reaching this part of the river because the new channel at the Victoria Ground bypasses two weirs, which were a barrier to fish passage. 
@EnvAgencyMids @CraigBennett3 @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/B65vmWzYs9
@MerseyRivers @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW @ccnw1 Wow looks fantastic! Can‚Äôt wait to help with the planting, it‚Äôs going to be a magical place this #naturematters

tweets.text: @Lifeboatmandave @highamjonny @Flowonthego Yes indeed! I had some good discussions with Fire and Rescue and @NCA_UK about non-hydrological applications a while back. Could be a huge benefit to safety. For @EnvAgency flood crews too......

We're working with @EnvAgency to deliver #NFM flood management techniques, slowing the flow of water from the hills to reduce flooding, across catchments in @EnvAgencyNW - including the construction of 200 mini-dams in Stalybridge #FloodActionWeek 

https://t.co/sNySGMrwcM https://t.co/NKOe0XYNGp
@MerseyRivers @CroxtethHall @EnvAgencyNW @cpvolgroup @ccnw1 The Alt runs down the side of @StVincentsL12  we have some ideas  for our little stretch  ....can we talk please.
@Nick_Everard @highamjonny @Flowonthego It would be interesting to try this out in flooding environments as part of my role as a volunteer Flood Rescue Team Manager.

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork @YorkCycleworks @YorkBikeBelles @YorkshireWater Cycling along a busy road which has no segregation is not an "alternative route" for people who use riverside path because it is safe and free of motor vehicles

This river once had a thriving population of Brown Trout true indicators of clean & unpolluted water River survey 2017/18 no Trout recorded üò≠funding needs to be found for a 2020 survey üôè https://t.co/YhSChc8joM

@paula_menso @TheMontyDon That needs to be reported to the @EnvAgency or @EnvAgencySE. I suspect there should be a trail of waste transfer info that will show the load hasn't been discharged to the right place, even if you didn't actually catch them in the act.

#flytipping is a #flooding issue. A361 culvert, immediately downstream of Athelney Spillway, partly blocked by flytipped fridge. This will cause the main road flood sooner, if spillway flow continues. @EnvAgencySW @IDBsomerset @SRAnews https://t.co/Dy3Y3sByfF
@EnvAgencySW Glad to see that you are  still liking a bit of culvert work @phil_pullen , even though you are on the wrong side of Exmoor now.

Walking today in the beautiful sunshine I met a family also enjoying the magnificent colours. We paused to discuss the dry Ivel Springs. The child listening asked ‚Äú who broke the river?‚Äù So @AquiferChalk @AffinityWater @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency who broke our chalk stream ? https://t.co/Ifth31WjGL
